column4: when i try to execute 'sudo gedit ...' it just sits there after password entry and doesnt load gedit ... this used to work just fine and it works when i do straight 'gedit' just not when i sudo; i havent touched sudoers or anything so im not sure where its going wrong .... any help would be appreciated
okay ... though it used to work like this before
you really should use gksudo with gui apps like gedit
do admin apps like Login Window open?

yes - everything through the GUI seems to be working okay .... except that sometimes GNOME Desktop manager takes about 5 minutes to kick in after initial boot (but its sperradic i cant recreate it, just happens randomly)
is it only gksudo gedit that  hangs?   does sudo nano work?
yes it does sudo vi, nano, pico all work just fine

ok humor me   open /etc/hostname  and /etc/hosts   files  iguess you'll have to use nano.  anyway check to see that  the second line in /etc/hosts    says                   127.0.1.1 <same as it says in /etc/hostname>
hostname just contains the name of the host, not the ip - and yes /etc/hosts is pointing that name to 127.0.1.1

there WAS another declaration for the same host pointing it to 127.0.0.1; i removed it from /etc/hosts but still hasnt fixed the issue (unless i have to log out or something, but normally you dont have to when editing /etc/hosts)
no shouldn't need to logout. ok well worth a shot. a lot of times if those two files don't match it causes   sudo problems
its cool its not really that big a deal, im going to be moving to a new laptop (fresh install) in a few days anyway was just curious
